oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Adding services to your veterinary practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gewiss, Cassandra
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: practice management
partial budget
veterinary business
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the evolution of veterinary private practices, it is common for services offered to be added and subtracted over time. The purpose of this paper is to discuss considerations and process recommendations to use when adding a new service within a veterinary practice. It is important to note that the discussion of adding services is not restricted to the owner(s) of a veterinary practice. While practice owners ought to be involved in the decision-making process, it is often associate veterinarians who have more avail­able time and drive to pursue these new service offerings. Topics to be discussed include understanding the “why”, per­forming market analysis on a prospective service, evaluating available time and financial resources, acquiring the skill, mar­keting the service, and follow-up recommendations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 175-177
